briefdescription.para: !cond INTERNAL
Creates a new empty Value instance.
Wraps a Node-API value primitive.

detaileddescription.para: Converts to a Node-API value primitive.
If the instance is empty, this returns nullptr.

briefdescription.para: Tests if this value strictly equals another value.
Tests if this value does not strictly equal another value.
Tests if this value strictly equals another value.
Gets the environment the value is associated with.

detaileddescription.para: Checks if the value is empty (uninitialized).

An empty value is invalid, and most attempts to perform an operation on an empty value will result in an exception. Note an empty value is distinct from JavaScript null or undefined, which are valid values.

When C++ exceptions are disabled at compile time, a method with a Value return type may return an empty value to indicate a pending exception. So when not using C++ exceptions, callers should check whether the value is empty before attempting to use it.

briefdescription.para: Gets the type of the value.
Tests if a value is an undefined JavaScript value.
Tests if a value is a null JavaScript value.
Tests if a value is a JavaScript boolean.
Tests if a value is a JavaScript number.
Tests if a value is a JavaScript string.
Tests if a value is a JavaScript symbol.
Tests if a value is a JavaScript array.
Tests if a value is a JavaScript array buffer.
Tests if a value is a JavaScript typed array.
Tests if a value is a JavaScript object.
Tests if a value is a JavaScript function.
Tests if a value is a JavaScript promise.
Tests if a value is a JavaScript data view.
Tests if a value is a Node buffer.
Tests if a value is a pointer to external data.

detaileddescription.para: Casts to another type of Napi::Value, when the actual type is known or assumed.
This conversion does NOT coerce the type. Calling any methods inappropriate for the actual value type will throw Napi::Error.
If NODE_ADDON_API_ENABLE_TYPE_CHECK_ON_AS is defined, this method asserts that the actual type is the expected type.

briefdescription.para: Coerces a value to a JavaScript boolean.
Coerces a value to a JavaScript number.
Coerces a value to a JavaScript string.
Coerces a value to a JavaScript object.

detaileddescription.para: Creates a JS value from a C++ primitive.

value may be any of:
bool
Any integer type
Any floating point type
const char* (encoded using UTF-8, null-terminated)
const char16_t* (encoded using UTF-16-LE, null-terminated)
std::string (encoded using UTF-8)
std::u16string
napi::Value
napi_value
A JavaScript value of unknown type.

For type-specific operations, convert to one of the Value subclasses using a To* or As() method. The To* methods do type coercion; the As() method does not. Napi::Value value = ... if (!value.IsString()) throw Napi::TypeError::New(env, "Invalid arg..."); Napi::String str = value.As<Napi::String>(); // Cast to a string value
Napi::Value anotherValue = ... bool isTruthy = anotherValue.ToBoolean(); // Coerce to a boolean value
